Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Good evening from the Field House at Washington University in St. Louis. I’m Charles Gibson of ABC News and “Good Morning America.”

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: I welcome you to the second of the 2004 presidential debates between President George W. Bush, the Republican nominee, and Senator John Kerry, the Democratic nominee.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: The debates are sponsored by the Commission on Presidential Debates.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Tonight’s format is going to be a bit different. We have assembled a town-hall meeting. We’re in the Show-Me State, as everyone knows Missouri to be, so Missouri residents will ask the questions.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: These 140 citizens were identified by the Gallup Organization as not yet committed in this election.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Now, earlier today, each audience member gave me two questions on cards like this, one they’d like to ask the president, the other they’d like to ask the senator.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: I have selected the questions to be asked and the order. No one has seen the final list of questions but me, certainly not the candidates.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: No audience member knows if he or she will be called upon. Audience microphones will be turned off after a question is asked.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Audience members will address their question to a specific candidate. He’ll have two minutes to answer. The other candidate will have a minute and a half for rebuttal. And I have the option of extending discussion for one minute, to be divided equally between the two men.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: All subjects are open for discussion.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: And you probably know the light system by now. Green light at 30 seconds, yellow at 15, red at five, and flashing red means you’re done.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Those are the candidates’ rules. I will hold the candidates to the time limits forcefully but politely, I hope.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: And now, please join me in welcoming with great respect, President Bush and Senator Kerry.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Gentlemen, to the business at hand.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: The first question is for Senator Kerry, and it will come from Cheryl Otis, who is right behind me.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: OTIS
Text: Senator Kerry, after talking with several co-workers and family and friends, I asked the ones who said they were not voting for you, “Why?” They said that you were too wishy-washy.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: OTIS
Text: Do you have a reply for them?

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Yes, I certainly do.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: But let me just first, Cheryl, if you will, I want to thank Charlie for moderating. I want to thank Washington University for hosting us here this evening.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Mr. President, it’s good to be with you again this evening, sir.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Cheryl, the president didn’t find weapons of mass destruction in Iraq, so he’s really turned his campaign into a weapon of mass deception. And the result is that you’ve been bombarded with advertisements suggesting that I’ve changed a position on this or that or the other.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Now, the three things they try to say I’ve changed position on are the Patriot Act; I haven’t. I support it. I just don’t like the way John Ashcroft has applied it, and we’re going to change a few things. The chairman of the Republican Party thinks we ought to change a few things.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: No Child Left Behind Act, I voted for it. I support it. I support the goals.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: But the president has underfunded it by $28 billion.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Right here in St. Louis, you’ve laid off 350 teachers. You’re 150 — excuse me, I think it’s a little more, about $100 million shy of what you ought to be under the No Child Left Behind Act to help your education system here.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: So I complain about that. I’ve argued that we should fully funded it. The president says I’ve changed my mind. I haven’t changed my mind: I’m going to fully fund it.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: So these are the differences.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Now, the president has presided over an economy where we’ve lost 1.6 million jobs. The first president in 72 years to lose jobs.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I have a plan to put people back to work. That’s not wishy- washy.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I’m going to close the loopholes that actually encourage companies to go overseas. The president wants to keep them open. I think I’m right. I think he’s wrong.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I’m going to give you a tax cut. The president gave the top 1 percent of income-earners in America, got $89 billion last year, more than the 80 percent of people who earn $100,000 or less all put together. I think that’s wrong. That’s not wishy-washy, and that’s what I’m fighting for, you.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Mr. President, a minute and a half.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Charlie, thank you, and thank our panelists.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: And, Senator, thank you.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I can — and thanks, Washington U. as well.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I can see why people at your workplace think he changes positions a lot, because he does. He said he voted for the $87 billion, and voted against it right before he voted for it. And that sends a confusing signal to people.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: He said he thought Saddam Hussein was a grave threat, and now he said it was a mistake to remove Saddam Hussein from power.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: No, I can see why people think that he changes position quite often, because he does.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: You know, for a while he was a strong supporter of getting rid of Saddam Hussein. He saw the wisdom — until the Democrat primary came along and Howard Dean, the anti-war candidate, began to gain on him, and he changed positions.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I don’t see how you can lead this country in a time of war, in a time of uncertainty, if you change your mind because of politics.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: He just brought up the tax cut. You remember we increased that child credit by $1,000, reduced the marriage penalty, created a 10 percent tax bracket for the lower-income Americans. That’s right at the middle class.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: He voted against it. And yet he tells you he’s for a middle- class tax cut. It’s — you’ve got to be consistent when you’re the president. There’s a lot of pressures. And you’ve got to be firm and consistent.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Mr. President, I would follow up, but we have a series of questions on Iraq, and so I will turn to the next questioner.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: The question is for President Bush, and the questioner is Robin Dahle.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: DAHLE
Text: Mr. President, yesterday in a statement you admitted that Iraq did not have weapons of mass destruction, but justified the invasion by stating, I quote, “He retained the knowledge, the materials, the means and the intent to produce weapons of mass destruction and could have passed this knowledge to our terrorist enemies.”

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: DAHLE
Text: Do you sincerely believe this to be a reasonable justification for invasion when this statement applies to so many other countries, including North Korea?

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Each situation is different, Robin.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: And obviously we hope that diplomacy works before you ever use force. The hardest decision a president makes is ever to use force.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: After 9/11, we had to look at the world differently. After 9/11, we had to recognize that when we saw a threat, we must take it seriously before it comes to hurt us.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: In the old days we’d see a threat, and we could deal with it if we felt like it or not. But 9/11 changed it all.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I vowed to our countrymen that I would do everything I could to protect the American people. That’s why we’re bringing Al Qaida to justice. Seventy five percent of them have been brought to justice.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: That’s why I said to Afghanistan: If you harbor a terrorist, you’re just as guilty as the terrorist. And the Taliban is no longer in power, and Al Qaida no longer has a place to plan.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: And I saw a unique threat in Saddam Hussein, as did my opponent, because we thought he had weapons of mass destruction.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: And the unique threat was that he could give weapons of mass destruction to an organization like Al Qaida, and the harm they inflicted on us with airplanes would be multiplied greatly by weapons of mass destruction. And that was the serious, serious threat.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: So I tried diplomacy, went to the United Nations. But as we learned in the same report I quoted, Saddam Hussein was gaming the oil-for-food program to get rid of sanctions. He was trying to get rid of sanctions for a reason: He wanted to restart his weapons programs.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: We all thought there was weapons there, Robin. My opponent thought there was weapons there. That’s why he called him a grave threat.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I wasn’t happy when we found out there wasn’t weapons, and we’ve got an intelligence group together to figure out why.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: But Saddam Hussein was a unique threat. And the world is better off without him in power.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: And my opponent’s plans lead me to conclude that Saddam Hussein would still be in power, and the world would be more dangerous.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Thank you, sir.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Senator Kerry, a minute and a half.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Robin, I’m going to answer your question.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I’m also going to talk — respond to what you asked, Cheryl, at the same time.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: The world is more dangerous today. The world is more dangerous today because the president didn’t make the right judgments.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Now, the president wishes that I had changed my mind. He wants you to believe that because he can’t come here and tell you that he’s created new jobs for America. He’s lost jobs.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: He can’t come here and tell you that he’s created health care for Americans because, what, we’ve got 5 million Americans who have lost their health care, 96,000 of them right here in Missouri.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: He can’t come here and tell you that he’s left no child behind because he didn’t fund no child left behind.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: So what does he do? He’s trying to attack me. He wants you to believe that I can’t be president. And he’s trying to make you believe it because he wants you to think I change my mind.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Well, let me tell you straight up - I’ve never changed my mind about Iraq. I do believe Saddam Hussein was a threat. I always believed he was a threat. Believed it in 1998 when Clinton was president. I wanted to give Clinton the power to use force if necessary.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: But I would have used that force wisely, I would have used that authority wisely, not rushed to war without a plan to win the peace.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I would have brought our allies to our side. I would have fought to make certain our troops had everybody possible to help them win the mission.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: This president rushed to war, pushed our allies aside. And Iran now is more dangerous, and so is North Korea, with nuclear weapons. He took his eye off the ball, off of Osama bin Laden.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Mr. President, I do want to follow up on this one, because there were several questions from the audience along this line.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: (OFF-MIKE)

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Go ahead. Go ahead.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Well, I was going to have you do the rebuttal on it, but you go ahead.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: You’re up.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: You remember the last debate?

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: My opponent said that America must pass a global test before we used force to protect ourselves. That’s the kind of mindset that says sanctions were working. That’s the kind of mindset that said, “Let’s keep it at the United Nations and hope things go well.”

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Saddam Hussein was a threat because he could have given weapons of mass destruction to terrorist enemies. Sanctions were not working. The United Nations was not effective at removing Saddam Hussein.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Senator?

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: The goal of the sanctions was not to remove Saddam Hussein, it was to remove the weapons of mass destruction. And, Mr. President, just yesterday the Duelfer report told you and the whole world they worked. He didn’t have weapons of mass destruction, Mr. President. That was the objective.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: And if we’d used smart diplomacy, we could have saved $200 billion and an invasion of Iraq. And right now, Osama bin Laden might be in jail or dead. That’s the war against terror.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: We’re going to have another question now on the subject of Iraq.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: And I’m going to turn to Anthony Baldi with a question for Senator Kerry.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Mr. Baldi?

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BALDI
Text: Senator Kerry, the U.S. is preparing a new Iraq government and will proceed to withdraw U.S. troops.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BALDI
Text: Would you proceed with the same plans as President Bush?

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Anthony, I would not. I have laid out a different plan, because the president’s plan is not working. You see that every night on television.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: There’s chaos in Iraq. King Abdullah of Jordan said just yesterday or the day before you can’t hold elections in Iraq with the chaos that’s going on today.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Senator Richard Lugar, the Republican chairman of the Foreign Relations Committee, said that the handling of the reconstruction aid in Iraq by this administration has been incompetent. Those are the Republican chairman’s words.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Senator Hagel of Nebraska said that the handling of Iraq is beyond pitiful, beyond embarrassing; it’s in the zone of dangerous.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Those are the words of two Republicans, respected, both on the Foreign Relations Committee.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Now, I have to tell you, I would do something different. I would reach out to our allies in a way that this president hasn’t. He pushed them away time and again, pushed them away at the U.N., pushed them away individually.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Two weeks ago, there was a meeting of the North Atlantic Council, which is the political arm of NATO. They discussed the possibility of a small training unit or having a total takeover of the training in Iraq.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Did our administration push for the total training of Iraq? No. Were they silent? Yes.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Was there an effort to bring all the allies together around that? No, because they’ve always wanted this to be an American effort.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: You know, they even had the Defense Department issue a memorandum saying, “Don’t bother applying for assistance or for being part of the reconstruction if you weren’t part of our original coalition.”

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Now, that’s not a good way to build support and reduce the risk for our troops and make America safer.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I’m going to get the training done for our troops. I’m going to get the training of Iraqis done faster. And I’m going to get our allies back to the table.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Two days ago in the Oval Office, I met with the finance minister from Iraq. He came to see me. And he talked about how optimistic he was and the country was about heading toward elections.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Think about it - They’re going from tyranny to elections.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: He talked about the reconstruction efforts that are beginning to take hold. He talked about the fact that Iraqis love to be free.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: He said he was optimistic when he came here, then he turned on the TV and listened to the political rhetoric and all of a sudden he was pessimistic.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Now, this is guy a who, along with others, has taken great risk for great freedom. And we need to stand with him.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: My opponent says he has a plan; it sounds familiar, because it’s called the Bush plan. We’re going to train troops, and we are. We’ll have 125,000 trained by the end of December. We’re spending about $7 billion.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: He talks about a grand idea - Let’s have a summit; we’re going to solve the problem in Iraq by holding a summit.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: And what is he going to say to those people that show up at the summit? Join me in the wrong war at the wrong time at the wrong place. Risk your troops in a war you’ve called a mistake.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Nobody is going to follow somebody who doesn’t believe we can succeed and with somebody who says that war where we are is a mistake.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I know how these people think. I meet with them all the time. I talk to Tony Blair all the time. I talk to Silvio Berlusconi. They’re not going to follow an American president who says follow me into a mistake. Our plan is working. We’re going to make elections. And Iraq is going to be free, and America will be better off for it.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Do you want to follow up, Senator?

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Yes, sir, please.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Ladies and gentlemen, the right war was Osama bin Laden and Afghanistan. That was the right place. And the right time was Tora Bora, when we had him cornered in the mountains.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Now, everyone in the world knows that there were no weapons of mass destruction. That was the reason Congress gave him the authority to use force, not after excuse to get rid of the regime.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Now we have to succeed. I’ve always said that. I have been consistent. Yes, we have to succeed, and I have a better plan to help us do it.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: First of all, we didn’t find out he didn’t have weapons until we got there, and my opponent thought he had weapons and told everybody he thought he had weapons.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: And secondly, it’s a fundamental misunderstanding to say that the war on terror is only Osama bin Laden. The war on terror is to make sure that these terrorist organizations do not end up with weapons of mass destruction. That’s what the war on terror is about.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Of course, we’re going to find Osama bin Laden. We’ve already 75 percent of his people. And we’re on the hunt for him.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: But this is a global conflict that requires firm resolve.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: The next question is for President Bush, and it comes from Nikki Washington.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: WASHINGTON
Text: Thank you.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: WASHINGTON
Text: Mr. President, my mother and sister traveled abroad this summer, and when they got back they talked to us about how shocked they were at the intensity of aggravation that other countries had with how we handled the Iraq situation.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: WASHINGTON
Text: Diplomacy is obviously something that we really have to really work on.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: WASHINGTON
Text: What is your plan to repair relations with other countries given the current situation?

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: No, I appreciate that. I — listen, I — we’ve got a great country. I love our values. And I recognize I’ve made some decisions that have caused people to not understand the great values of our country.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I remember when Ronald Reagan was the president; he stood on principle. Somebody called that stubborn. He stood on principle standing up to the Soviet Union, and we won that conflict. Yet at the same time, he was very — we were very unpopular in Europe because of the decisions he made.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I recognize that taking Saddam Hussein out was unpopular. But I made the decision because I thought it was in the right interests of our security.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: You know, I’ve made some decisions on Israel that’s unpopular. I wouldn’t deal with Arafat, because I felt like he had let the former president down, and I don’t think he’s the kind of person that can lead toward a Palestinian state.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: And people in Europe didn’t like that decision. And that was unpopular, but it was the right thing to do.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I believe Palestinians ought to have a state, but I know they need leadership that’s committed to a democracy and freedom, leadership that would be willing to reject terrorism.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I made a decision not to join the International Criminal Court in The Hague, which is where our troops could be brought to — brought in front of a judge, an unaccounted judge.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I don’t think we ought to join that. That was unpopular.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: And so, what I’m telling you is, is that sometimes in this world you make unpopular decisions because you think they’re right.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: We’ll continue to reach out.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Listen, there is 30 nations involved in Iraq, some 40 nations involved in Afghanistan.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: People love America. Sometimes they don’t like the decisions made by America, but I don’t think you want a president who tries to become popular and does the wrong thing.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: You don’t want to join the International Criminal Court just because it’s popular in certain capitals in Europe.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Senator Kerry, a minute and a half.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Nikki, that’s a question that’s been raised by a lot of people around the country.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Let me address it but also talk about the weapons the president just talked about, because every part of the president’s answer just now promises you more of the same over the next four years.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: The president stood right here in this hall four years ago, and he was asked a question by somebody just like you, “Under what circumstances would you send people to war?”

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: And his answer was, “With a viable exit strategy and only with enough forces to get the job done.”

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: He didn’t do that. He broke that promise. We didn’t have enough forces.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: General Shinseki, the Army chief of staff, told him he was going to need several hundred thousand. And guess what? They retired General Shinseki for telling him that.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: This president hasn’t listened.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I went to meet with the members of the Security Council in the week before we voted. I went to New York. I talked to all of them to find out how serious they were about really holding Saddam Hussein accountable.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I came away convinced that, if we worked at it, if we were ready to work and letting Hans Blix do his job and thoroughly go through the inspections, that if push came to shove, they’d be there with us.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: But the president just arbitrarily brought the hammer down and said, “Nope. Sorry, time for diplomacy is over. We’re going.”

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: He rushed to war without a plan to win the peace.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Ladies and gentleman, he gave you a speech and told you he’d plan carefully, take every precaution, take our allies with us. He didn’t. He broke his word.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Mr. President?

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I remember sitting in the White House looking at those generals, saying, “Do you have what you need in this war? Do you have what it takes?”

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I remember going down to the basement of the White House the day we committed our troops as last resort, looking at Tommy Franks and the generals on the ground, asking them, “Do we have the right plan with the right troop level?”

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: And they looked me in the eye and said, “Yes, sir, Mr. President.” Of course, I listen to our generals. That’s what a president does. A president sets the strategy and relies upon good military people to execute that strategy.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Senator?

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: You rely on good military people to execute the military component of the strategy, but winning the peace is larger than just the military component.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: General Shinseki had the wisdom to say, “You’re going to need several hundred thousand troops to win the peace.” The military’s job is to win the war.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: A president’s job is to win the peace.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: The president did not do what was necessary. Didn’t bring in enough nation. Didn’t deliver the help. Didn’t close off the borders. Didn’t even guard the ammo dumps. And now our kids are being killed with ammos right out of that dump.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: The next question is for Senator Kerry, and it comes from over here, from Randee Jacobs.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: You’ll need a microphone.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Is it Randee?

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: JACOBS
Text: Yes, Randee.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: JACOBS
Text: Iran sponsors terrorism and has missiles capable of hitting Israel and southern Europe. Iran will have nuclear weapons in two to three years time.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: JACOBS
Text: In the event that U.N. sanctions don’t stop this threat, what will you do as president?

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I don’t think you can just rely on U.N. sanctions, Randee. But you’re absolutely correct, it is a threat, it’s a huge threat.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: And what’s interesting is, it’s a threat that has grown while the president has been preoccupied with Iraq, where there wasn’t a threat.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: If he’d let the inspectors do their job and go on, we wouldn’t have 10 times the numbers of forces in Iraq that we have in Afghanistan chasing Osama bin Laden.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Meanwhile, while Iran is moving toward nuclear weapons, some 37 tons of what they called yellow cake, the stuff they use to make enriched uranium, while they’re doing that, North Korea has moved from one bomb maybe, maybe, to four to seven bombs.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: For two years, the president didn’t even engage with North Korea, did nothing at all, while it was growing more dangerous, despite the warnings of former Secretary of Defense William Perry, who negotiated getting television cameras and inspectors into that reactor.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: We were safer before President Bush came to office. Now they have the bombs and we’re less safe.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: So what do we do? We’ve got to join with the British and the French, with the Germans, who’ve been involved, in their initiative. We’ve got to lead the world now to crack down on proliferation as a whole.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: But the president’s been slow to do that, even in Russia.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: At his pace, it’s going to take 13 years to reduce and get ahold of all the loose nuclear material in the former Soviet Union. I’ve proposed a plan that can capture it and contain it and clean it within four years.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: And the president is moving to the creation of our own bunker- busting nuclear weapon. It’s very hard to get other countries to give up their weapons when you’re busy developing a new one.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I’m going to lead the world in the greatest counterproliferation effort. And if we have to get tough with Iran, believe me, we will get tough.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Mr. President, a minute and a half.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: That answer almost made me want to scowl.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: He keeps talking about, “Let the inspectors do their job.” It’s naive and dangerous to say that. That’s what the Duelfer report showed. He was deceiving the inspectors.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Secondly, of course we’ve been involved with Iran.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I fully understand the threat. And that’s why we’re doing what he suggested we do: Get the Brits, the Germans and the French to go make it very clear to the Iranians that if they expect to be a party to the world to give up their nuclear ambitions. We’ve been doing that.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Let me talk about North Korea.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: It is naive and dangerous to take a policy that he suggested the other day, which is to have bilateral relations with North Korea. Remember, he’s the person who’s accusing me of not acting multilaterally. He now wants to take the six-party talks we have — China, North Korea, South Korea, Russia, Japan and the United States — and undermine them by having bilateral talks.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: That’s what President Clinton did. He had bilateral talks with the North Koreans. And guess what happened?

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: He didn’t honor the agreement. He was enriching uranium. That is a bad policy.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Of course, we’re paying attention to these. It’s a great question about Iran. That’s why in my speech to the Congress I said: There’s an “Axis of Evil,” Iraq, Iran and North Korea, and we’re paying attention to it. And we’re making progress.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: We’re going to move on, Mr. President, with a question for you. And it comes from Daniel Farley.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Mr. Farley?

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: FARLEY
Text: Mr. President, since we continue to police the world, how do you intend to maintain our military presence without reinstituting a draft?

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Yes, that’s a great question. Thanks.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I hear there’s rumors on the Internets (sic) that we’re going to have a draft. We’re not going to have a draft, period. The all- volunteer army works. It works particularly when we pay our troops well. It works when we make sure they’ve got housing, like we have done in the last military budgets.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: An all-volunteer army is best suited to fight the new wars of the 21st century, which is to be specialized and to find these people as they hide around the world.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: We don’t need mass armies anymore. One of the things we’ve done is we’ve taken the — we’re beginning to transform our military.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: And by that I mean we’re moving troops out of Korea and replacing them with more effective weapons. We don’t need as much manpower on the Korean Peninsula to keep a deterrent.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: In Europe, we have massed troops as if the Soviet Union existed and was going to invade into Europe, but those days are over with. And so we’re moving troops out of Europe and replacing it with more effective equipment.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: So to answer your question is, we’re withdrawing, not from the world, we’re withdrawing manpower so they can be stationed here in America, so there’s less rotation, so life is easier on their families and therefore more likely to be — we’ll be more likely to be able to keep people in the all-volunteer army.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: One of the more important things we’re doing in this administration is transformation. There are some really interesting technologies.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: For instance, we’re flying unmanned vehicles that can send real- time messages back to stations in the United States. That saves manpower, and it saves equipment.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: It also means that we can target things easier and move more quickly, which means we need to be lighter and quicker and more facile and highly trained.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Now, forget all this talk about a draft. We’re not going to have a draft so long as I am the president.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Senator Kerry, a minute and a half.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Daniel, I don’t support a draft.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: But let me tell you where the president’s policies have put us.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: The president — and this is one of the reasons why I am very proud in this race to have the support of General John Shalikashvili, former chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff; Admiral William Crowe, former chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff; General Tony McPeak, who ran the air war for the president’s father and did a brilliant job, supporting me; General Wes Clark, who won the war in Kosovo, supporting me; because they all — and General Baca, who was the head of the National Guard, supporting me.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Why? Because they understand that our military is overextended under the president.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Our Guard and reserves have been turned into almost active duty. You’ve got people doing two and three rotations. You’ve got stop-loss policies, so people can’t get out when they were supposed to. You’ve got a back-door draft right now.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: And a lot of our military are underpaid. These are families that get hurt. It hurts the middle class. It hurts communities, because these are our first responders. And they’re called up. And they’re over there, not over here.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Now, I’m going to add 40,000 active duty forces to the military, and I’m going to make people feel good about being safe in our military, and not overextended, because I’m going to run a foreign policy that actually does what President Reagan did, President Eisenhower did, and others.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: We’re going to build alliances. We’re not going to go unilaterally. We’re not going to go alone like this president did.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Mr. President, let’s extend for a minute…

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Let me just — I’ve got to answer this.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Exactly. And with Reservists being held on duty…

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Let me answer what he just said, about around the world.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Well, I want to get into the issue of the back-door draft…

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: You tell Tony Blair we’re going alone. Tell Tony Blair we’re going alone. Tell Silvio Berlusconi we’re going alone. Tell Aleksander Kwasniewski of Poland we’re going alone.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: There are 30 countries there. It denigrates an alliance to say we’re going alone, to discount their sacrifices. You cannot lead an alliance if you say, you know, you’re going alone. And people listen. They’re sacrificing with us.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Senator?

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Mr. President, countries are leaving the coalition, not joining. Eight countries have left it.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: If Missouri, just given the number of people from Missouri who are in the military over there today, were a country, it would be the third largest country in the coalition, behind Great Britain and the United States.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: That’s not a grand coalition.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Ninety percent of the casualties are American. Ninety percent of the costs are coming out of your pockets.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I could do a better job. My plan does a better job. And that’s why I’ll be a better commander in chief.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: The next question, Senator Kerry, is for you, and it comes from Ann Bronsing, who I believe is over in this area.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BRONSING
Text: Senator Kerry, we have been fortunate that there have been no further terrorist attacks on American soil since 9/11. Why do you think this is?

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BRONSING
Text: And if elected, what will you do to assure our safety?

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Thank you very much, Ann.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I’ve asked in my security briefings why that is, and I can’t go into all the answers, et cetera, but let me say this to you.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: This president and his administration have told you and all of us it’s not a question of when, it’s a question of — excuse me — not a question of if, it’s a question of when. We’ve been told that.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: The when I can’t tell you. Between the World Trade Center bombing in, what was it, 1993 or so, and the next time was five years, seven years. These people wait. They’ll plan. They plot.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: I agree with the president that we have to go after them and get them wherever they are. I just think I can do that far more effectively, because the most important weapon in doing that is intelligence. You’ve got to have the best intelligence in the world.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: And in order to have the best intelligence in the world to know who the terrorists are and where they are and what they’re plotting, you’ve got to have the best cooperation you’ve ever had in the world.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Now, to go back to your question, Nikki, we’re not getting the best cooperation in the world today. We’ve got a whole bunch of countries that pay a price for dealing with the United States of America now. I’m going to change that.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: And I’m going to put in place a better homeland security effort.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Look, 95 percent of our containers coming into this country are not inspected today. When you get on an airplane, your bag is X- rayed, but the cargo hold isn’t X-rayed. Do you feel safer?

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: This president in the last debate said, “Well, that would be a big tax gap if we did that.”

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: Ladies and gentlemen, it’s his tax plan. He chose a tax cut for the wealthiest Americans over getting that equipment out into the homeland as fast as possible.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: We have bridges and tunnels that aren’t being secured, chemical plants, nuclear plants that aren’t secured, hospitals that are overcrowded with their emergency rooms.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: If we had a disaster today, could they handle it?

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: KERRY
Text: This president chose a tax cut over homeland security. Wrong choice.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: GIBSON
Text: Mr. President?

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: That’s an odd thing to say, since we’ve tripled the homeland security budget from $10 billion to $30 billion.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: Listen, we’ll do everything we can to protect the homeland.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: My opponent’s right, we need good intelligence. It’s also a curious thing for him to say since right after 1993 he voted to cut the intelligence budget by $7.5 billion.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: The best way to defend America in this world we live in is to stay on the offense. We got to be right 100 percent of the time here at home, and they got to be right once. And that’s the reality.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: And there’s a lot of good people working hard. We’re doing the best we possibly can to share information. That’s why the Patriot Act was important.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: The Patriot Act is vital, by the way. It’s a tool that law enforcement now uses to be able to talk between each other. My opponent says he hadn’t changed his position on it. No, but he’s for weakening it.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I don’t think my opponent has got the right view about the world to make us safe; I really don’t.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: First of all, I don’t think he can succeed in Iraq. And if Iraq were to fail, it’d be a haven for terrorists, and there would be money and the world would be much more dangerous.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I don’t see how you can win in Iraq if you don’t believe we should be there in the first place. I don’t see how you can lead troops if you say it’s the wrong war at the wrong place at the wrong time.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
Text: I don’t see how the Iraqis are going to have confidence in the American president if all they hear is that it was a mistake to be there in the first place.

Title: October 8, 2004 Debate Transcript
Participants: GEORGE W. BUSHPRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES U.S. SENATOR JOHN F. KERRY (MA)DEMOCRATIC PRESIDENTIAL NOMINEE
Speaker: BUSH
